channel.title: Loading mapback
channel.description: I have been told that I must recreate the method that my client's client.java loads the MAPBACK 0.png to make it load the sprite successfully. It doesn't make sense to me that this is required, considering that the loading method works for every other sprite. Would somebody please confirm this method is correct, and explain how I would be to go about doing this, or if there is another way, how could I do it?

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Jordonc2005:

It’s done from client.java, i’ll pm you how if ya want, it worked fine for me.

I don’t think it would be.
class Client handles a connected client, nothing to do with the UI for the client.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Okay, so I took the line in the client that reads the mapback, and changed from sub2 to sub1, then I traced all of the methods that it accesses, changed them to access sub1, and compiled without errors. Then upon load, it goes to the error on loading config. I am going to test if it is even accessing the mapback correctly with a printIn, but I doubt that it is even accessing it. Thank you to all that have helped, or at least tried to help. effort is appreciated.

EDIT:
The stream is saying that I have loaded mapback correctly. Now that’s because I have it access both sub2 and sub1, so the config doesn’t crash. If i don’t allow it to access sub2, it says it loads the mapback from sub1, but it crashes on loading config.

EDIT 2:
It is actually crashing on 100, which is ‘preparing game engine’

Read full topic

you don’t change anything in Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2…its done in client and Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Thank you. I have heard that it is something in client.java, but I haven’t been able to find any map loaders in there other than the dots and markers.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 29, 2007, 08:15:59 PM[/size][hr]Managed to get the pixelgrabber into Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2.
Here is the whole code I have in there:

[code] public Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(Class44 class44, String s, int i)
{
aBoolean1447 = false;
anInt1448 = 360;
aByte1449 = 3;

(class44.method571(s + “.dat”, null), 891);

(class44.method571(“index.dat”, null), 891);
class30_sub2_sub2_1.anInt1406 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410();

anInt1457 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method410();
int j = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method408();
anIntArray1451 = new int[j];
for(int k = 0; k < j - 1; k++)
anIntArray1451[k + 1] = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method412();

    for(int l = 0; l < i; l++)
    {
        class30_sub2_sub2_1.anInt1406 += 2;
        class30_sub2_sub2.anInt1406 += class30_sub2_sub2_1.method410() *

class30_sub2_sub2_1.method410();
class30_sub2_sub2_1.anInt1406++;
}

    anInt1454 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method408();
    anInt1455 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method408();
    anInt1452 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method410();
    anInt1453 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method410();
    int i1 = class30_sub2_sub2_1.method408();
    int j1 = anInt1452 * anInt1453;
    aByteArray1450 = new byte[j1];
anIntArray1439 = new int[j1];

if (s.startsWith(“mapback”))
{
try
{
Image image =

Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/"+s+""+i+".png");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440

  • anInt1441];
    PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new

PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

		}
		catch (Exception exception)
		{
			System.out.println(((Object)

(exception)));
}
}

if(i1 == 0)
{
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < j1; k1++)
aByteArray1450[k1] = class30_sub2_sub2.method409();

        return;
    }
    if(i1 == 1)
    {
        for(int l1 = 0; l1 < anInt1452; l1++)
        {
            for(int i2 = 0; i2 < anInt1453; i2++)
                aByteArray1450[l1 + i2 * anInt1452] =

class30_sub2_sub2.method409();

        }

    }
}[/code]

Then I added this to Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1, to define that the sprite is loading somewhere else (I would assume, this is from another client I found)

else if (s.startsWith("mapback")) { return; }
Everything loads fine, EXCEPT THE MAPBACK. For fuck’s sake, i’m getting pissed.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @playermanny2 playermanny2

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I do. unless you can’t fucking see, i have a nearly full custom gameframe. I think that I might know where to put my custom sprite codes. The mapback does NOT load from class30_sub2_sub1_sub1! It loads from the cache, but there is a way to mask that with your custom sprites. It isn’t as easy and scribbling out a chat box and swapping the files.

And i know I need to change how the client reads the map. I have to get it to read the map aside from the standard mapback, and load mine instead. Thus, where the point of this post comes in to play.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

that will not work unless you have the mapback load from Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(custom sprites) instead of Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2 (loads from cache)

then you will have to rewrite how the client positions it, and how the client makes the map load…and change all of that

Read full topic

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

See my picture? Notice the part that ISN’T edited. That is the mapback.
Yours is default, so obviously you didn’t edit it. Try to edit it. Go into paint, open MAPBACK 0.jag (or .png or .jpg, w/E) and scribble on it. Then save. It doesn’t change ingame. There is something that creates the map, that is autoloading the default from the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading mapback
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

That doesn’t load a custom mapback… that’s the problem. It’s apparently something that few people know how to do, and I’m stumped. I have browsed client.java and found map stuff, tested it all, and none if it has anything to do with loading that (except for the loader that reads class30_sub2_sub1_sub1)

Read full topic
